name: @fuzdev/fuz_css
logo_alt: a fuzzy tuft of green moss

package_json.name: @fuzdev/fuz_css
package_json.logo_alt: a fuzzy tuft of green moss

declarations.name: CachedExtraction
declarations.doc_comment:
Cached extraction result for a single file.
Uses `null` instead of empty arrays to avoid allocation overhead.

properties.name: v
properties.doc_comment: Cache version - invalidates cache when bumped

properties.name: content_hash
properties.doc_comment: SHA-256 hash of the source file contents

properties.name: classes
properties.doc_comment: Classes as [name, locations] tuples, or null if none

properties.name: diagnostics
properties.doc_comment: Extraction diagnostics, or null if none

declarations.name: get_cache_path
declarations.doc_comment:
Computes the cache file path for a source file.
Cache structure mirrors source tree: `src/lib/Foo.svelte` â†’ `.fuz/cache/css/src/lib/Foo.svelte.json`
declarations.type_signature: (source_path: string, cache_dir: string, project_root: string): string

parameters.name: source_path
parameters.description: - Absolute path to the source file

parameters.name: cache_dir
parameters.description: - Absolute path to the cache directory

declarations.name: load_cached_extraction
declarations.doc_comment:
Loads a cached extraction result from disk.
Returns `null` if the cache is missing, corrupted, or has a version mismatch.
This makes the cache self-healing: any error triggers re-extraction.

parameters.name: cache_path
parameters.description: - Absolute path to the cache file

declarations.name: save_cached_extraction
declarations.doc_comment:
Saves an extraction result to the cache.
Uses atomic write (temp file + rename) for crash safety.
Converts empty arrays to null to avoid allocation overhead on load.
declarations.type_signature: (cache_path: string, content_hash: string, classes: Map<string, SourceLocation[]> | null, diagnostics: ExtractionDiagnostic[] | null): Promise<...>

parameters.name: cache_path
parameters.description: - Absolute path to the cache file

parameters.name: content_hash
parameters.description: - SHA-256 hash of the source file contents

parameters.name: classes
parameters.description: - Extracted classes with their locations, or null if none

parameters.name: diagnostics
parameters.description: - Extraction diagnostics, or null if none

declarations.name: delete_cached_extraction
declarations.doc_comment:
Deletes a cached extraction file.
Silently succeeds if the file doesn't exist.

parameters.name: cache_path
parameters.description: - Absolute path to the cache file

declarations.name: from_cached_extraction
declarations.doc_comment:
Converts a cached extraction back to the runtime format.
Preserves null semantics (null = empty).
declarations.type_signature: (cached: CachedExtraction): { classes: Map<string, SourceLocation[]> | null; diagnostics: ExtractionDiagnostic[] | null; }
declarations.return_type: { classes: Map<string, SourceLocation[]> | null; diagnostics: ExtractionDiagnostic[] | null; }

modules.module_comment:
Cache infrastructure for incremental CSS class extraction.

Provides per-file caching with content hash validation to avoid
re-extracting classes from unchanged files.

declarations.name: css_class_definitions
declarations.doc_comment: All built-in CSS class definitions (token classes + composites).

modules.module_comment:
Built-in CSS class definitions combining token classes and composites.

Token classes map to CSS variables (design tokens).
For other CSS properties, use CSS-literal syntax like `display:flex` or `position:absolute`.

declarations.name: ExtractionResult
declarations.doc_comment:
Extraction result with classes mapped to their source locations.
Uses `null` instead of empty collections to avoid allocation overhead.

Uses embedded diagnostics (rather than a Result type) because file extraction
can partially succeed: some classes may be extracted while others produce errors.
This differs from  which uses a discriminated union
because single-class parsing is binary success/failure.

properties.name: classes
properties.doc_comment:
Map from class name to locations where it was used, or null if none.
Keys = unique classes, values = locations for diagnostics/IDE integration.

properties.name: tracked_vars
properties.doc_comment: Variables that were used in class contexts, or null if none

properties.name: diagnostics
properties.doc_comment: Diagnostics from the extraction phase, or null if none

declarations.name: AcornPlugin
declarations.doc_comment: Acorn plugin type - a function that extends the Parser class.

declarations.name: ExtractCssClassesOptions
declarations.doc_comment: Options for CSS class extraction.

properties.name: filename
properties.doc_comment:
File path used to determine extraction method (Svelte vs TS)
and for location tracking in diagnostics.

properties.name: acorn_plugins
properties.doc_comment:
Additional acorn plugins to use when parsing TS/JS files.
Useful for adding JSX support via `acorn-jsx` for React projects.

declarations.name: SourceIndex
declarations.doc_comment:
Helper class for converting character offsets to line/column positions.
Svelte template nodes (Comment, Text, ExpressionTag) only have char offsets,
so this class enables efficient conversion.

Build: O(n) where n = source length
Lookup: O(log m) where m = number of lines (binary search)

members.name: get_location
members.doc_comment: Converts a character offset to a source location.

declarations.name: extract_from_svelte
declarations.doc_comment: Extracts CSS classes from a Svelte file using AST parsing.
declarations.return_description: Extraction result with classes, tracked variables, and diagnostics

declarations.name: extract_from_ts
declarations.doc_comment: Extracts CSS classes from a TypeScript/JS file using AST parsing.
declarations.type_signature: (source: string, file?: string, acorn_plugins?: AcornPlugin[] | undefined): ExtractionResult
declarations.return_description: Extraction result with classes, tracked variables, and diagnostics

parameters.name: acorn_plugins
parameters.description: - Additional acorn plugins (e.g., acorn-jsx for React)

declarations.name: extract_css_classes
declarations.doc_comment:
Unified extraction function that auto-detects file type.
Returns just the class names as a Set.
declarations.return_description: Set of class names

declarations.name: extract_css_classes_with_locations
declarations.doc_comment:
Unified extraction function that auto-detects file type.
Returns full extraction result with locations and diagnostics.
declarations.return_description: Full extraction result with classes, tracked variables, and diagnostics

modules.module_comment:
AST-based CSS class extraction for Svelte and TypeScript files.

Replaces regex-based extraction with proper parsing to handle:
- `class="display:flex"` - string attributes
- `class={{ active, disabled: !enabled }}` - object attributes (Svelte 5.16+)
- `class={[cond && 'box', 'display:flex']}` - array attributes (Svelte 5.16+)
- `class:active={cond}` - class directives
- `clsx('foo', { bar: true })` - class utility function calls
- Variables with class-related names
- `// @fuz-classes class1 class2` - comment hints for dynamic classes

declarations.name: escape_css_selector
declarations.doc_comment:
Escapes special characters in a CSS class name for use in a selector.
CSS selectors require escaping of characters like `:`, `%`, `(`, `)`, etc.

declarations.name: CssClassInterpreterContext
declarations.doc_comment:
Context passed to CSS class interpreters.
Provides access to logging, diagnostics collection, and the class registry.

properties.name: log
properties.doc_comment: Optional logger for warnings/errors

properties.name: diagnostics
properties.doc_comment: Diagnostics array to collect warnings and errors

properties.name: class_definitions
properties.doc_comment: All known CSS class definitions (token + composite classes)

properties.name: css_properties
properties.doc_comment: Valid CSS properties for literal validation, or null to skip validation

declarations.name: GenerateClassesCssResult
declarations.doc_comment: Result from CSS class generation.

properties.name: css_properties
properties.doc_comment: Valid CSS properties for literal validation, or null to skip validation

modules.module_comment:
CSS class generation utilities.

Produces CSS output from class definitions, handles interpretation of
dynamic classes, and provides collection management for extracted classes.

declarations.name: generate_classes
declarations.doc_comment:
Generates CSS class declarations from templates.
Supports up to 3 dimensions of multiplicative combinations.
declarations.type_signature: <T1 = string, T2 = string, T3 = string>(template: ClassTemplateFn<T1, T2, T3>, values: Iterable<T1>, secondary?: Iterable<T2> | undefined, tertiary?: Iterable<...> | undefined): Record<...>

parameters.name: template
parameters.description: - Function that generates CSS from values, can return null to skip

parameters.name: tertiary
parameters.description: - Optional third dimension for even more combinations

declarations.name: format_spacing_value
declarations.doc_comment:
Format spacing values for CSS (handles 0, auto, percentages, pixels, and CSS variables).
Used by margin, padding, gap, inset, top/right/bottom/left, etc.

declarations.name: format_dimension_value
declarations.doc_comment:
Format width/height values for CSS (handles 0, auto, percentages, pixels, content values, and CSS variables).
Used by width and height properties.

declarations.name: generate_property_classes
declarations.doc_comment: Generate classes for a single CSS property with various values.
declarations.type_signature: (property: string, values: Iterable<string>, formatter?: ((value: string) => string) | undefined, prefix?: string): Record<string, CssClassDefinition>

parameters.name: values
parameters.description: - The values to generate classes for

parameters.name: formatter
parameters.description: - Optional function to format values (e.g. v => `var(--space_${v})`)

parameters.name: prefix
parameters.description: - Optional class name prefix (defaults to property with dashes replaced by underscores)

declarations.name: generate_directional_classes
declarations.doc_comment:
Generate directional classes for properties like margin and padding.
Creates classes for all directions: base, top, right, bottom, left, x (horizontal), y (vertical).
declarations.type_signature: (property: string, values: Iterable<string>, formatter?: ((v: string) => string) | undefined): Record<string, CssClassDefinition>

parameters.name: values
parameters.description: - The values to generate classes for

parameters.name: formatter
parameters.description: - Optional function to format values (defaults to identity)

declarations.name: generate_border_radius_corners
declarations.doc_comment:
Generate border radius corner classes for all four corners.
Creates classes for top-left, top-right, bottom-left, bottom-right corners.
declarations.type_signature: (values: Iterable<string>, formatter?: ((value: string) => string) | undefined): Record<string, CssClassDefinition>

parameters.name: values
parameters.description: - The values to generate classes for

declarations.name: generate_shadow_classes
declarations.doc_comment:
Generate shadow classes for various shadow types and sizes.
Creates classes for regular, top, bottom, inset, inset-top, and inset-bottom shadows.
Each shadow uses color-mix with alpha values for transparency.
declarations.type_signature: (sizes: Iterable<string>, alpha_mapping: Record<string, string>): Record<string, CssClassDefinition>

parameters.name: sizes
parameters.description: - The shadow size variants (xs, sm, md, lg, xl)

parameters.name: alpha_mapping
parameters.description: - Mapping of sizes to alpha numbers (1-5)

declarations.name: modified_class_interpreter
declarations.doc_comment:
Interpreter for modified token/composite classes (e.g., `hover:p_md`, `md:box`, `dark:hover:panel`).
Applies modifiers to existing declaration-based or ruleset-based classes.

This interpreter must run BEFORE css_literal_interpreter to handle cases like `hover:box`
where `box` is a known class (not a CSS property).

declarations.name: css_literal_interpreter
declarations.doc_comment:
Interpreter for CSS-literal classes (e.g., `display:flex`, `hover:opacity:80%`).
Generates full CSS rulesets including any modifier wrappers.

declarations.name: css_class_interpreters
declarations.doc_comment:
Collection of all builtin interpreters for dynamic CSS class generation.
Order matters: modified_class_interpreter runs first to handle `hover:box` before
css_literal_interpreter tries to interpret it as `hover:box` (property:value).

declarations.name: CssClasses
declarations.doc_comment:
Collection of CSS classes extracted from source files.
Tracks classes per-file for efficient incremental updates.
Uses `null` instead of empty collections to avoid allocation overhead.

members.name: add
members.doc_comment:
Adds extraction results for a file.
Replaces any previous classes and diagnostics for this file.
members.type_signature: (id: string, classes: Map<string, SourceLocation[]> | null, diagnostics?: ExtractionDiagnostic[] | null | undefined): void

parameters.name: classes
parameters.description: - Map of class names to their source locations, or null if none

parameters.name: diagnostics
parameters.description: - Extraction diagnostics from this file, or null if none

members.name: get
members.doc_comment:
Gets all unique class names as a Set.
For backward compatibility.

members.name: get_with_locations
members.doc_comment:
Gets all classes with their source locations.
Locations from include_classes are null.

members.name: get_all
members.doc_comment:
Gets all classes and their locations in a single call.
More efficient than calling `get()` and `get_with_locations()` separately
when both are needed (avoids potential double recalculation).
members.type_signature: (): { all_classes: Set<string>; all_classes_with_locations: Map<string, SourceLocation[] | null>; }
members.return_type: { all_classes: Set<string>; all_classes_with_locations: Map<string, SourceLocation[] | null>; }

members.name: get_diagnostics
members.doc_comment: Gets all extraction diagnostics from all files.

modules.module_comment:
Collection management for extracted CSS classes.

Tracks classes per-file for efficient incremental updates during watch mode.
Uses `null` instead of empty collections to avoid allocation overhead.

declarations.name: ParsedCssLiteral
declarations.doc_comment: Parsed CSS-literal class with all components extracted.

properties.name: class_name
properties.doc_comment: Original class name

properties.name: media
properties.doc_comment: Media modifier (breakpoint or feature query)

properties.name: ancestor
properties.doc_comment: Ancestor modifier (dark/light)

properties.name: states
properties.doc_comment: State modifiers in alphabetical order (can have multiple)

properties.name: pseudo_element
properties.doc_comment: Pseudo-element modifier (before, after, etc.)

properties.name: property
properties.doc_comment: CSS property name

properties.name: value
properties.doc_comment: CSS value (with ~ replaced by spaces)

declarations.name: CssLiteralParseResult
declarations.doc_comment:
Result of parsing a CSS-literal class name.

Uses a discriminated union (Result type) because parsing a single class
is binary: it either succeeds or fails entirely. This differs from
 which uses embedded diagnostics because file
extraction can partially succeed (some classes extracted, others have errors).

declarations.name: ExtractedModifiers
declarations.doc_comment:
Extracted modifiers from a class name.
Used by both CSS-literal parsing and modified class interpretation.

properties.name: media
properties.doc_comment: Media modifier (breakpoint or feature query)

properties.name: ancestor
properties.doc_comment: Ancestor modifier (dark/light)

properties.name: states
properties.doc_comment: State modifiers in alphabetical order (can have multiple)

properties.name: pseudo_element
properties.doc_comment: Pseudo-element modifier (before, after, etc.)

declarations.name: ModifierExtractionResult
declarations.doc_comment: Result of extracting modifiers from segments.

declarations.name: InterpretCssLiteralResult
declarations.doc_comment: Result of interpreting a CSS-literal class.

declarations.name: load_css_properties
declarations.doc_comment: Loads CSS properties from

declarations.name: is_valid_css_property
declarations.doc_comment:
Checks if a property name is a valid CSS property.
Custom properties (--*) always return true.
declarations.return_description: True if valid CSS property or custom property

parameters.name: property
parameters.description: - The CSS property name to validate

parameters.name: properties
parameters.description:
- Set of valid CSS properties from `load_css_properties()`.
  Pass `null` to skip validation.

declarations.name: suggest_css_property
declarations.doc_comment: Suggests a correct property name for a typo using Levenshtein distance.
declarations.type_signature: (typo: string, properties: Set<string> | null): string | null
declarations.return_description: The suggested property or null if no close match (Levenshtein distance > 2)

parameters.name: properties
parameters.description:
- Set of valid CSS properties from `load_css_properties()`.
  Pass `null` to skip suggestions.

declarations.name: suggest_modifier
declarations.doc_comment: Suggests a correct modifier name for a typo using Levenshtein distance.
declarations.return_description: The suggested modifier or null if no close match (Levenshtein distance > 2)

declarations.name: format_css_value
declarations.doc_comment:
Formats a CSS-literal value for CSS output.
- Replaces `~` with space
- Ensures space before `!important`
declarations.return_description: Formatted CSS value

declarations.name: check_calc_expression
declarations.doc_comment: Checks if a value contains a possibly invalid calc expression.
declarations.return_description: Warning message if suspicious, null otherwise

declarations.name: is_possible_css_literal
declarations.doc_comment:
Checks if a class name could be a CSS-literal class.
Quick check before attempting full parse.
declarations.return_description: True if it could be CSS-literal syntax

declarations.name: extract_segments
declarations.doc_comment:
Extracts colon-separated segments from a class name, handling parentheses.
Parenthesized content (like function arguments) is kept intact.

declarations.name: extract_and_validate_modifiers
declarations.doc_comment:
Extracts and validates modifiers from the beginning of a segments array.
Modifiers are consumed from the front until a non-modifier segment is found.

Used by both CSS-literal parsing and modified class interpretation.
declarations.return_description: ModifierExtractionResult with modifiers and remaining segments, or error

parameters.name: class_name
parameters.description: - Original class name for error messages

declarations.name: parse_css_literal
declarations.doc_comment: Parses a CSS-literal class name into its components.
declarations.return_description: CssLiteralParseResult with parsed data or error

parameters.name: css_properties
parameters.description:
- Set of valid CSS properties from `load_css_properties()`.
  Pass `null` to skip property validation.

declarations.name: generate_selector
declarations.doc_comment:
Generates the CSS selector for a parsed CSS-literal class.
Includes state pseudo-classes and pseudo-element in the selector.

declarations.name: generate_declaration
declarations.doc_comment: Generates the CSS declaration for a parsed CSS-literal class.

declarations.name: CssLiteralOutput
declarations.doc_comment: Information needed to generate CSS output for a CSS-literal class.

properties.name: declaration
properties.doc_comment: CSS declaration (property: value;)

properties.name: selector
properties.doc_comment: Full CSS selector including pseudo-classes/elements

properties.name: media_wrapper
properties.doc_comment: Media query wrapper if any

properties.name: ancestor_wrapper
properties.doc_comment: Ancestor wrapper if any

declarations.name: interpret_css_literal
declarations.doc_comment:
Interprets a CSS-literal class and returns CSS generation info.

Callers should first check `is_possible_css_literal()` to filter non-CSS-literal classes.
declarations.type_signature: (class_name: string, escaped_class_name: string, css_properties: Set<string> | null): InterpretCssLiteralResult
declarations.return_description: Result with output and warnings on success, or error on failure

parameters.name: escaped_class_name
parameters.description: - The CSS-escaped version of the class name

parameters.name: css_properties
parameters.description:
- Set of valid CSS properties from `load_css_properties()`.
  Pass `null` to skip property validation.

declarations.name: generate_css_literal_simple
declarations.doc_comment:
Generates simple CSS for a CSS-literal class (without grouping).
Used by the interpreter for basic output.
declarations.return_description: CSS string for this class

modules.module_comment:
CSS-literal syntax parser, validator, and interpreter.

Enables writing utility classes using actual CSS syntax:

- `display:flex` â†’ `.display\:flex { display: flex; }`
- `hover:opacity:80%` â†’ `.hover\:opacity\:80\%:hover { opacity: 80%; }`
- `md:dark:hover:before:opacity:80%` â†’ nested CSS with media query, ancestor, state, pseudo-element

@see {@link https://github.com/fuzdev/fuz_css} for documentation

declarations.name: ParsedRule
declarations.doc_comment: A parsed CSS rule with its components and positions.

properties.name: selector
properties.doc_comment: Full selector string (e.g., ".box", ".selectable:hover")

properties.name: selector_start
properties.doc_comment: Start position of selector in original CSS (0-indexed, relative to style wrapper)

properties.name: selector_end
properties.doc_comment: End position of selector in original CSS

properties.name: declarations
properties.doc_comment: The declarations block (without braces)

properties.name: rule_start
properties.doc_comment: Start position of the entire rule

properties.name: rule_end
properties.doc_comment: End position of the entire rule

declarations.name: ParsedRuleset
declarations.doc_comment: Result of parsing a CSS ruleset.

properties.name: rules
properties.doc_comment: All rules in the ruleset

properties.name: wrapper_offset
properties.doc_comment: The offset added by the <style> wrapper (characters before actual CSS)

declarations.name: parse_ruleset
declarations.doc_comment: Parses a CSS ruleset string using Svelte's CSS parser.
declarations.return_description: ParsedRuleset with structured rule data and positions

declarations.name: is_single_selector_ruleset
declarations.doc_comment:
Checks if a ruleset has only a single simple selector (just the class name).
Used to detect rulesets that could be converted to declaration format.
declarations.return_description: True if there's exactly one rule with selector ".class_name"

declarations.name: extract_css_comment
declarations.doc_comment:
Extracts the CSS comment from a ruleset (if any).
Looks for comments before the first rule.
declarations.return_description: Comment text without delimiters, or null if no comment

declarations.name: SkippedModifierInfo
declarations.doc_comment:
Information about a modifier that was skipped for a selector during ruleset modification.
The selector is still included in output, just without the conflicting modifier applied.

properties.name: selector
properties.doc_comment: The specific selector where the modifier was skipped (not the full selector list)

properties.name: reason
properties.doc_comment: Reason the modifier was skipped

properties.name: conflicting_modifier
properties.doc_comment: The conflicting modifier that was not applied (e.g., "::before" or ":hover")

declarations.name: ModifiedSelectorGroupResult
declarations.doc_comment: Result from modifying a selector group with conflict detection.

properties.name: selector
properties.doc_comment: The modified selector list as a string

properties.name: skipped_modifiers
properties.doc_comment: Information about modifiers skipped for specific selectors

declarations.name: ModifiedRulesetResult
declarations.doc_comment: Result from generating a modified ruleset.

properties.name: css
properties.doc_comment: The generated CSS

properties.name: skipped_modifiers
properties.doc_comment: Information about modifiers that were skipped for certain rules

declarations.name: split_selector_list
declarations.doc_comment: Splits a selector list by commas, respecting parentheses.

declarations.name: find_compound_end
declarations.doc_comment:
Finds the end position of the compound selector containing the class at class_pos.
A compound selector is a sequence of simple selectors without combinators.
declarations.return_description: Position where state modifiers should be inserted (before any pseudo-element)

declarations.name: modify_single_selector
declarations.doc_comment: Modifies a single CSS selector to add modifiers.
declarations.type_signature: (selector: string, original_class: string, new_class_escaped: string, state_css: string, pseudo_element_css: string): string
declarations.return_description: Modified selector

parameters.name: selector
parameters.description: - A single CSS selector (not a selector list)

declarations.name: modify_selector_group
declarations.doc_comment:
Modifies a selector list (comma-separated selectors) to add modifiers.
Handles conflicts per-selector: if one selector in a list has a conflict,
only that selector skips the modifier; other selectors still get it.
declarations.type_signature: (selector_group: string, original_class: string, new_class_escaped: string, states_to_add: string[], pseudo_element_css: string): ModifiedSelectorGroupResult
declarations.return_description: Result with modified selector list and information about skipped modifiers

declarations.name: generate_modified_ruleset
declarations.doc_comment:
Generates CSS for a modified ruleset with applied modifiers.

Conflict handling is per-selector within selector lists:
- For `.plain:hover, .plain:active` with `hover:` modifier, only `.plain:hover` skips
  the `:hover` addition; `.plain:active` still gets `:hover` appended.
- For multiple states like `:hover:focus`, each is checked individually; conflicting
  states are skipped while non-conflicting ones are still applied.
declarations.type_signature: (original_ruleset: string, original_class: string, new_class_escaped: string, state_css: string, pseudo_element_css: string, media_wrapper: string | null, ancestor_wrapper: string | null): ModifiedRulesetResult
declarations.return_description: Result with generated CSS and information about skipped modifiers

parameters.name: new_class_escaped
parameters.description: - The escaped new class name with modifiers

modules.module_comment:
CSS ruleset parser using Svelte's CSS parser.

Parses CSS rulesets to extract selectors and declarations with position information.
Used for:
- Phase 0a: Detecting single-selector rulesets that could be converted to declaration format
- Phase 2: Modifying selectors for modifier support on composite classes

NOTE: We wrap CSS in a `<style>` tag for Svelte's parser. This adds an offset to positions.
Line numbers in parser errors will be offset by 1. This is acceptable - Fuz will have
its own CSS parser in the future.

declarations.name: SourceLocation
declarations.doc_comment: Source location for IDE/LSP integration.

properties.name: line
properties.doc_comment: 1-based line number

properties.name: column
properties.doc_comment: 1-based column number

declarations.name: BaseDiagnostic
declarations.doc_comment: Base diagnostic with common fields.

declarations.name: ExtractionDiagnostic
declarations.doc_comment: Diagnostic from the extraction phase.

declarations.name: GenerationDiagnostic
declarations.doc_comment: Diagnostic from the generation phase.

properties.name: locations
properties.doc_comment: Source locations where this class was used, or null if from include_classes

declarations.name: Diagnostic
declarations.doc_comment: Union of all diagnostic types.

declarations.name: CssClassDiagnostic
declarations.doc_comment:
Diagnostic from CSS class interpretation.
Used internally by interpreters; converted to GenerationDiagnostic with locations.

declarations.name: create_generation_diagnostic
declarations.doc_comment: Converts a CssClassDiagnostic to a GenerationDiagnostic with locations.

parameters.name: locations
parameters.description: - Source locations where the class was used

modules.module_comment:
Diagnostic types for CSS class extraction and generation.

Provides a unified diagnostic system across all phases:
- Extraction: Parsing source files to find class names
- Generation: Producing CSS output from class definitions

properties.name: on_error
properties.doc_comment:
How to handle CSS-literal errors during generation.
- 'log' (default): Log errors, skip invalid classes, continue
- 'throw': Throw on first error, fail the build

properties.name: include_classes
properties.doc_comment:
Classes to always include in the output, regardless of whether they're detected in source files.
Useful for dynamically generated class names that can't be statically extracted.

properties.name: exclude_classes
properties.doc_comment:
Classes to exclude from the output, even if they're detected in source files.
Useful for filtering out false positives from extraction.

properties.name: cache_dir
properties.doc_comment: Cache directory relative to project_root.

properties.name: project_root
properties.doc_comment: Project root directory. Source paths must be under this directory.

properties.name: concurrency
properties.doc_comment:
Max concurrent file processing (cache read + extract).
Bottlenecked by CPU-bound AST parsing.

properties.name: cache_io_concurrency
properties.doc_comment: Max concurrent cache writes and deletes (I/O-bound).

properties.name: acorn_plugins
properties.doc_comment:
Additional acorn plugins to use when parsing TS/JS files.
Useful for adding JSX support via `acorn-jsx` for React projects.

declarations.name: CssGenerationError
declarations.doc_comment: Error thrown when CSS-literal generation encounters errors and `on_error: 'throw'` is set.

modules.module_comment:
Gro generator for creating optimized utility CSS from extracted class names.
Scans source files, extracts CSS classes with AST-based parsing, and generates
only the CSS for classes actually used. Includes per-file caching with content
hash validation for fast incremental rebuilds.

declarations.name: ModifierType
declarations.doc_comment:
Type of modifier determining its position in the class name and CSS output.

Order in class names: `[media]:[ancestor]:[state...]:[pseudo-element]:property:value`

declarations.name: ModifierDefinition
declarations.doc_comment: Definition for a single modifier.

properties.name: name
properties.doc_comment: The prefix used in class names (e.g., 'hover', 'md', 'dark')

properties.name: type
properties.doc_comment: Type determines position in modifier order and CSS output behavior

properties.name: css
properties.doc_comment: The CSS output - wrapper for media/ancestor, suffix for state/pseudo-element

properties.name: order
properties.doc_comment: Optional ordering within type (for breakpoints, sorted by this value)

declarations.name: MODIFIERS
declarations.doc_comment:
All modifier definitions in a single declarative structure.
Adding a new modifier requires only adding to this array.

declarations.name: MEDIA_MODIFIERS
declarations.doc_comment: Map of media modifier names to their CSS output

declarations.name: ANCESTOR_MODIFIERS
declarations.doc_comment: Map of ancestor modifier names to their CSS output

declarations.name: STATE_MODIFIERS
declarations.doc_comment: Map of state modifier names to their CSS output

declarations.name: PSEUDO_ELEMENT_MODIFIERS
declarations.doc_comment: Map of pseudo-element modifier names to their CSS output

declarations.name: ALL_MODIFIER_NAMES
declarations.doc_comment: All modifier names for quick lookup

declarations.name: ARBITRARY_MIN_WIDTH_PATTERN
declarations.doc_comment: Pattern for arbitrary min-width breakpoints: `min-width(800px):`

declarations.name: ARBITRARY_MAX_WIDTH_PATTERN
declarations.doc_comment: Pattern for arbitrary max-width breakpoints: `max-width(600px):`

declarations.name: NTH_CHILD_PATTERN
declarations.doc_comment: Pattern for parameterized nth-child: `nth-child(2n+1):`

declarations.name: NTH_OF_TYPE_PATTERN
declarations.doc_comment: Pattern for parameterized nth-of-type: `nth-of-type(2n):`

declarations.name: parse_arbitrary_breakpoint
declarations.doc_comment: Parses an arbitrary breakpoint modifier.
declarations.return_description: The CSS media query or null if not an arbitrary breakpoint

declarations.name: parse_parameterized_state
declarations.doc_comment: Parses a parameterized state modifier (nth-child, nth-of-type).
declarations.type_signature: (segment: string): { name: string; css: string; type: "state"; } | null
declarations.return_type: { name: string; css: string; type: "state"; } | null
declarations.return_description: Object with name (including parameter) and CSS, or null if not parameterized

declarations.name: get_modifier
declarations.doc_comment:
Gets the modifier definition for a segment.
Handles both static modifiers and dynamic patterns (arbitrary breakpoints, parameterized states).
declarations.return_description: The modifier definition or null if not a known modifier

declarations.name: get_all_modifier_names
declarations.doc_comment: Gets all modifier names for error message suggestions.

modules.module_comment:
Declarative modifier definitions for CSS-literal syntax.

Modifiers enable responsive, state-based, and contextual styling:
- Media modifiers: `md:`, `print:`, `motion-safe:`
- Ancestor modifiers: `dark:`, `light:`
- State modifiers: `hover:`, `focus:`, `disabled:`
- Pseudo-element modifiers: `before:`, `after:`

@see {@link https://github.com/fuzdev/fuz_css} for documentation

properties.name: specificity
properties.doc_comment:
Repeats the theme selector to handle unpredictable head content insertion order.
Accepts any integer >= 1, defaults to 2.

declarations.name: render_theme_variable
declarations.type_signature: (variable: StyleVariable, dark?: boolean, comments?: boolean): string

declarations.name: default_themes
declarations.doc_comment: These are super basic proof-of-concept themes.

declarations.name: icon_sizes
declarations.type_signature: { icon_size_xs: string; icon_size_sm: string; icon_size_md: string; icon_size_lg: string; icon_size_xl: string; icon_size_xl2: string; icon_size_xl3: string; }

declarations.name: Z_INDEX_MAX
declarations.doc_comment: Maximum value for CSS z-index property (32-bit signed integer max).

declarations.name: default_variables
declarations.doc_comment:
These are implicitly the variables for the `base` theme.
See also the empty `variables` array of the `base` theme above.
